Functions

const char *IPDR_API_LINKAGE IPDR_StatusMsg (IPDR_ExporterHandle ExporterHandle, IPDR_Status Status)

Detailed Description

These are used by a variety of API functions. Where possible, void pointers have been avoided, instead using pointers-to-struct, which allows the compiler to do some extra type-checking.

Define Documentation

#define IPDR_API   IPDR_Status IPDR_API_LINKAGE
 

A convenience macro for defining the return value and linkage for an API function.

#define IPDR_API_LINKAGE
 

The linkage type to add to each external function declaration (mainly for Windows).

#define IPDR_DEFAULT_ADDRESS   0
 

Value to use for "default" IP address (for type IPDR_IPAddress).

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct IPDR_tag_Collector* IPDR_CollectorHandle
 

typedef struct IPDR_tag_Exporter* IPDR_ExporterHandle
 

The information for a transmitter (client), as created by IPDR_InitExporter().

typedef unsigned int IPDR_IPAddress
 

An internal IP address (#unint32_t). Following ancient tradition, it is kept in host byte order, not network byte order.

typedef unsigned long long IPDR_MACAddress
 

MAC address definition

typedef struct IPDR_tag_PlatformArg* IPDR_PlatformArg
 

The type used as a context argument when calling platform function.

typedef struct IPDR_tag_Session* IPDR_SessionHandle
 

The information for a session, as created by IPDR_CreateSession().

typedef struct IPDR_tag_SocketEvent* IPDR_SocketEventID
 

The information about an event that is triggered by a socket becoming available for I/O. In effect, this is a "callback". If the socket is handled by non-blocking I/O, the callback is called when the file descriptor (socket) becomes available for I/O (or has had something traumatic happen to it, such as being closed). In the case of blocking I/O, the callback is used by the generic thread which repeatedly does the I/O. (Note: for the blocking case - which has a thread - the event is not put into the list of non-blocking callbacks.)

typedef unsigned int IPDR_Status
 

Type returned by a IPDR API function. Actual values are given by the enumeration IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE.

typedef struct IPDR_tag_TemplateHandle IPDR_TemplateHandle
 

The information for a template, as created by IPDR_CreateTemplate(). This should be treated as an opaque type, with no reliance on the actual structure, which may change in the future.

typedef long IPDR_Time
 

A time value as seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT)) (the number of bits in the type should be the same as or larger than time_t).

typedef struct IPDR_tag_Timer* IPDR_TimerID
 

The information about a timer.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE
 

Status / Error codes.

See also:
IPDR_Status
Enumeration values:
IPDR_OK  Everything worked fine (guaranteed to be zero value)
IPDR_ERR_MEMORY_FREE  It Is Some logic error trying to free already freed memory
IPDR_ERR_SESSION_LOGICALLY_RUN  Session was already stoped or not started yet by API
IPDR_ERR_SESSION_LOGICALLY_STOPED  Session was already stoped or not started yet by API
IPDR_ERR_OPERATION_WOULD_BLOCK  Non-blocking I/O and operation would block; or operation could not be completed within specified timeout.
IPDR_ERR_COLLECTORSESSION_REASSOC  Collecotr Session Reasociation Actually changing priority
IPDR_ERR  A generic error, not otherwise distinguished.
IPDR_ERR_INVALID_VALUE  A parameter or other value was invalid.
IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED  Out of memory (possibly caused by a parameterized limitation).
IPDR_ERR_NO_AVAILABLE_TIMERS  Could not allocate another timer.
IPDR_ERR_TIMER_NOT_FOUND  Timer ID was invalid: timer does not exist.
IPDR_ERR_TIMER_ALREADY_STARTED  Attempted an illegal operation on an already started timer.
IPDR_ERR_TIMER_NOT_STARTED  Attempted an illegal operation on a timer that isn't started.
IPDR_ERR_PERSISTENCE_ERROR  Could not open or read from non-volatile memory.
IPDR_ERR_COMMUNICATION_ERROR  I/O error on network, open or close error, or end-of-file on read.
IPDR_ERR_ADDRESS_ALREADY_IN_USE  Could not open specified address/port because already in use, restricted, or invalid.
IPDR_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED  Function is not implemented.
IPDR_ERR_SESSION_ALREADY_EXISTS  Tried to create a session with an ID that has already been used and not released by IPDR_DeleteSession().
IPDR_ERR_UNABLE_TO_FIND_SESSION  Tried to operate on a session that has not been created or is not valid for a particular transmitter (client).
IPDR_ERR_PORT_ALREADY_IN_USE  Could not open specified port because already in use, restricted, or invalid.
IPDR_ERR_COLLECTOR_ALREADY_EXISTS  Tried to add a collector (server) that had already been added.
IPDR_ERR_COLLECTOR_NOT_FOUND  Tried to operate on a collector (server) that has not been added.
IPDR_ERR_TEMPLATE_ALREADY_EXISTS  Tried to create a template with an ID that has already been used.
IPDR_ERR_TEMPLATE_NOT_FOUND  Tried to operate on a template that has not been created.
IPDR_ERR_KEY_NOT_FOUND  Tried to operate on a tamplte key that has not been created.
IPDR_ERR_KEY_ALREADY_EXISTS  Tried to create a key whose ID, Name, or Label already exists.
IPDR_ERR_QUEUE_FULL  Could not allocate any more memory to the queue (possibly because of a parameterized limitation.
IPDR_ERR_NOT_RUNNING  Tried to do an operation that requires having IPDR_StartExporter() first (see also IPDR_IsRunning(). Can also be produced if certain internal errors occurred which prevent further processing. If you get this when you don't expect it, about the only thing you can do is call IPDR_DeleteExporter().
IPDR_ERR_MIB_VERSION_MISMATCH  Configuration data (MIB data) was a different version than expected.
IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND  MIB NODE not found in lookup.
IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_WRITABLE  MIB NODE not writable (attempt to "set" failed).
IPDR_ERR_NO_ACTIVE_COLLECTOR  No active collector (server), or collector (server) is disconnected.
IPDR_ERR_ALREADY_RUNNING  Attempt to start transmitter (client) when it's already running, or doing an operation that must be done before IPDR_StartExporter().
IPDR_CMD_EXIT  Returned from IPDR_DoConsoleCommand() to indicate an "exit" command.
IPDR_CMD_NOT_FOUND  Returned from IPDR_DoConsoleCommand() to indicate a command wasn't found.
IPDR_CMD_HELP  Returned from IPDR_DoConsoleCommand() to indicate a "help" command.
IPDR_ERR_TEMPLATE_DISABLED  Tried to send data on a disabled template.
IPDR_ERR_ACTIVE_COLLECTOR_EXISTS  Tried to start a session while an active collector already exists for that session.
IPDR_ERR_API_CALL_FROM_CALLBACK 
IPDR_ERR_COLLECTOR_NOT_IN_SESSION  Collector not associated with any session
IPDR_ERR_SESSION_IS_RUNNING  Command may executed when the Session is stoped
IPDR_ERR_SESSION_IS_NOT_RUNNING  Command may executed when the Session is running

Function Documentation

const char* IPDR_API_LINKAGE IPDR_StatusMsg (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_Status  Status
) 
 

Convert a return code into an English string.

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter(). This may be NULL, which might result in a slightly less informative message; it also might result in using a static area for creating the message.
Status the result of a call a IPDR API call.
Returns:
A string with the English string, if the Status parameter is one of the Status / Error codes given by IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE. If the the status is IPDR_OK, the return value is the empty string (""). If the status is not a valid code, a dynamically-created string is created. This string is valid only until another call of IPDR_StatusMsg() and is not thread-safe. 
00245 {
00246         static char buf[256];
00247         memset(buf, 0, 256);
00248     typedef struct { IPDR_Status code; const char* msg; } CodeAndMsg_t;
00249 
00250     static CodeAndMsg_t codeAndMsg[] = {
00251         { IPDR_OK,                          "Result OK" },
00252         { IPDR_ERR,                         "General error" },
00253         { IPDR_ERR_INVALID_VALUE,           "Invalid value" },
00254         { IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED,       "Memory allocation failed" },
00255         { IPDR_ERR_NO_AVAILABLE_TIMERS,     "No available timers" },
00256         { IPDR_ERR_TIMER_NOT_FOUND,         "Timer not found" },

00296 
00297     CodeAndMsg_t* cm;
00298     for (cm = codeAndMsg; cm->msg != 0; cm++) {
00299         if (cm->code == Status) {
00300                         sprintf(buf, "%s - %s <%u>", SUCCESS(cm->code)?"SUCCESS":"FAILURE", cm->msg, Status);
00301             return buf;
00302         }
00303     }
00304 
00305     /* If C != NULL, we should use an area within it; but the
00306        following should suffice because we're just constructing a
00307        message and that situation shouldn't occur anyway. */
00308 
00309     { /* Unknown status code: construct a useful message */
00310         sprintf(buf, "FAILURE - Unknown Result Code <%du>", Status);
00311         return buf;
00312     }
